p: The two most serious impacts of influenza virus on the lung are the development of pneumonia and exacerbation of pre-existing pulmonary disease [ 60]. Such events seem rare and variable during most seasonal influenza periods, but may be more frequent and severe in pandemics. During the 2018–2019 season, there was an estimated 32 million cases of influenza resulting in 32 000 deaths in the USA [ 61]. H1N1, the virus behind the 1918 and 2009 pandemics, appears to cause more rapid and severe pneumonia than other strains, with higher rates of bacterial superinfection [ 62]. H1N1 also affects the paediatric population [ 63, 64].
